entities.name: Securities giving access to share capital

entities.description: Increases or decreases of the share capital may only be carried out upon collective decision of the shareholders, deciding on the President’s management report.

Increases of the share capital may be carried out either by issuance of ordinary shares or preferred shares, or by raising the nominal value of the existing shares. The increase may also be carried out by the exercise of the rights related to securities giving access to the share capital, in the conditions provided for by the law.

company which controls it
entities.description: a company which controls SYSTRAN SAS
Shares and any other securities issued by the company shall be in nominative form and entered in an account.
Shares are freely transferable by account transfer in the company's books, applicable only to paid-up shares.

entities.eventName: Issuance of Securities Other Than Shares
entities.description: Issuance of bonds decided or authorized by Board of Directors upon President's proposal. Issuance of securities giving access to capital or debt instruments authorized by extraordinary shareholder decision.
Shares are indivisible vis-à-vis the company; joint owners represented by one proxy, or appointed by Presiding Judge of Commercial Court.

entities.eventName: Rights and Obligations Attached to Shares
entities.description: Possession of a share entails acceptance of bylaws and duly adopted shareholder resolutions.

convened fifteen (15) days at least before the meeting, either by ordinary letter or by registered letter, or by fax or an electronic mean of telecommunication.
Only questions on the agenda shall be submitted to a vote unless the shareholders are all present and decide by mutual agreement to deliberate on other questions.
Shareholder not replying within deadline for written consultation is considered abstained.

entities.description: Shareholder's right to participate if shares are registered in their name.

entities.name: company having another form
entities.description: a company with a different legal form

entities.eventName: Drawing up of Accounts and Reports
entities.description: President draws up inventory, annual accounts, and management report at financial year closing.
Accounting documents and management report available to auditors one month before shareholders' right to information.
Accounting documents and reports presented and submitted to shareholders' approval within six months of financial year closing.
Five percent deducted from profit (less prior losses) for legal reserve fund.
Allocation to legal reserve fund stops when fund reaches one-tenth of share capital.
Allocation to legal reserve fund applies again if reserve decreases below one-tenth of share capital.
Distributable profit is financial year profit less prior losses and legal reserve deduction, increased by retained earnings.
Shareholders may decide to carry forward profit.

entities.eventName: Allocate Profit to Reserve Funds Decision
entities.description: Shareholders may decide to allocate profit to general or special reserve funds.
Shareholders may decide to distribute profit as dividends.

entities.eventName: Distribution of Sums from Reserves Decision
entities.description: Shareholders may decide to distribute sums deducted from reserves, with express mention of reserve accounts.
Dividend shall be deducted by priority from the distributable profit of the financial year.
Revaluation variance shall not be distributed.

entities.eventName: Revaluation Variance Incorporation to Share Capital
entities.description: Revaluation variance may be incorporated partially or totally to the share capital.
President may distribute deposits on dividends before account approval, as per law.
Dividend paid annually at time/place determined by shareholders or President, within 9 months of financial year closing.

entities.eventName: Extension of Dividend Payment Time Limit
entities.description: Time limit for dividend payment may be extended by order of Presiding Judge of Commercial Court.
Company may be transformed into another legal form as per bylaws and legal provisions.
President provokes a collective decision of shareholders to decide on the extension or not of the company, at least one year before its expiration.
Decision of shareholders regarding early dissolution shall be published.
Completion of publication formalities for dissolution.

All disputes that may arise during the life of the company or its liquidation, either between the shareholders, or between the company and the shareholders themselves, relating to the interpretation or the performance of these bylaws, or more generally relating to company matters
The publication formalities shall be realized upon diligence of the President of the company.
